instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message:
Hey all this one came water damage. lvds was bad and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> pins were gone. SO i ran jumpers and turned on the macbook and boom - instant smoke.
So i go over thunderbolt and check all components around <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and make sure everything is good. Re done the <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> now v2 with jumpers to get connection as it burnt out prety bad and again - boom and it smoked.

Can anyone help?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message: Forget it remove <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and live without thunderbolt it is a total waste of time. Does the board have backlight and turn on without <CHIP>U9410</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message: its booting without it. I will connect to a good machine see if display working too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message: ok so no display. pin 2,3 no voltage but 4 is measuring 3.33v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message: short to ground on pp3v42? how can it still power?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message:
Are you sure is short there???
Is impossible, if board starts...
I hope you removed charger and battery when checked that.

"pin 2,3 no voltage but 4 is measuring 3.33v"
Do you talk about J9000?
Check volyage and resistance to ground at pins 6 & 7.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> keeps blowing.
threads.message: idk wth is going on but i checked too many bad looking components. this one going to junk pile.
